intro: Pyrethrum fischeri, commonly known as the Fischer's pyrethrum, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its daisy-like yellow flowers. The plant produces fine, hair-like structures called trichomes, which contain pyrethrins—natural insecticides. These compounds make it effective against a variety of pests. Due to its toxic properties, it is often cultivated for use in organic pest control products.
